description: Supply chains have become far-flung and global as companies expand their operations to new markets and new supply sources. Concurrently, a number of macrotrends in outsourcing, near-shoring, changing country regulations and regional trade agreements, impact of technologies and new business models., new logistics infrastructure, etc, are emerging. These cause changes and evolution of traditional supply chains structures and assumptions. Companies will have to continuously evaluate their strategies and adapt their supply chains to deal with these changes. They will need to improve their flexibility, coordination, and responsiveness to deal with the risks and opportunities.
preclusion: DSC5211A Supply Chain Co-ordination & Risk Management
title: Supply Chain Risk Management
